page.title: 12PENGAM AREA I
page.content: THE OLD AIRPORT USED TO BE AT PENGAM MOORS WHERE THE ROVER WORKS ARE NOW.THE AERODRONE OPENED IN 1931 AND CLOSED IN 1954,THEN ALL THE AIRCRAFT WERE TRANSFERED TO RHOOSE AIRPORT WHICH IS RUN BY GLAMORGAN COUNTY COUNCIL.MARK'S GRAMPY WILLIS WAS A PILOT AND FLEW FROM THE OLD AIRPORT DURING THE WAR.PART OF PENGAM AERODROME CLOSED BECAUSE THE BIGGER AIRCRAFT NEEDED LONGER AND BETTER RUNWAYS AND BETTER BACK_UP SERVICES LIKE RADAR AND LIGHTING.THE EARLY AIRCRAFT FLYING FROM PENGAM MOORS WERE WESTLAND WESSEX AND DE HAVILAND FOX_MOTHS.THE ROVER WORKS PERSONNEL OFFICER SENT US A LETTER AND BOOKLETS IN WHICH IT SAID THAT THE ROVER WORKS OPENED IN 1961 AND HAS MADE VARIOUS PARTS FOR LAND ROVERS,RANGE ROVERS,FREIGHT ROVERS,ROVER 2000 SERIES AND THE JAGUAR XJ SERIES.
